teams.name: Portugal
teams.loan_because:
Honramos o legado deixado pelos nossos antepassados que espalharam cultura, conhecimento e valores por todo o mundo. Onde há um português, há um amigo pronto a ajudar e dar esperança aos que mais precisam. Isto é Portugal.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
We honor the legacy of our ancestors who spread our culture, knowledge and values around the world. Wherever there is a Portuguese, there is a friend willing to help and give hope to those in need. This is Portugal.
teams.description: Portuguese Lenders Team

teams.name: Indiana
teams.loan_because: We believe people around the world are connected and we can make a positive difference in others' lives.
teams.description:
Indiana is the 19th U.S. state and is located in the Midwest region of the United States of America. With over six million residents, it is ranked 15th in population and 17th in population density.

Indiana is a diverse state with a few large urban areas and a number of smaller industrial cities. It is best known for the Indianapolis 500 American automobile race, held annually over the Memorial Day weekend, and a strong basketball tradition, often called Hoosier Hysteria. Residents of Indiana are called Hoosiers. The state's name means "Land of the Indians."

Check out the distribution of our team's impact around the world: 
http://kivafolio.appspot.com/report?user=indiana

To see a map showing where Indiana team members are located, click the link below.

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: RPCVs for Kiva - Returned Peace Corps Volunteers
teams.loan_because: we want to continue our service after returning from the Peace Corps

teams.name: Humanist
teams.loan_because: It takes people to help people.  We believe in good.
teams.description:
Humanists strive to live good and ethical lives, with no belief in the supernatural.  We give meaning and purpose to our lives through reason, compassion and action.

Most Atheists and non-religious people ARE Humanists, but don't realize it!

Our team helps the poor, builds the Humanist community and shows that non-religious people give, care and share.

We are endorsed by the American Humanist Association, British Humanist Association and International Humanist and Ethical Union.

teams.name: GLBT (Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender) Kivans & Friends
teams.loan_because: We are out and proud and know what it is like to face barriers. We are privileged to help our entrepreneurs achieve their own equality. We thank our friends who join us in our loans & in supporting GLBT rights.
teams.description: We are gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, homosexual, and heterosexual people from all over the world.

teams.name: New York
teams.loan_because: New York is full of entrepreneurs so we want to support others around the world, and give them the opportunity to alleviate themselves out of poverty.
teams.description:
We are a group of like minded New Yorkers who connect to make a difference.

Please note, Team Message unrelated to Kiva New York team lending & activities may be deleted.  Please keep posts related to the team!

http://gplus.to/kivany

teams.name: Amy Poehler's Smart Girls
teams.loan_because: You change the world one kindness at a time.
teams.description: Amy Poehler's Smart Girls knows there is still inequality all over the world. The basis of that inequality is that you are being denied the ability to be yourself. We must all be be able to make choices that can lead to a better life. Micro-loans make choices available.

teams.name: women empowering women
teams.loan_because: empower a woman, change the world.

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.name: Team Europe
teams.loan_because: We think Kiva is a unique opportunity for people all over the world to assist entrepreneurs in improving their businesses and communities.
teams.description: We are European lenders (EU, EFTA, and all those who feel they belong) who share the belief in Kiva's vision.

teams.name: Ravelry.com
teams.loan_because: We want to support crafts people all over the world.
teams.description: We are a group of knitters and crocheters that want to support other crafts people around the world

teams.name: Kiva France
teams.description: Team of french kiva lenders

teams.name: Cats Are People Too.
teams.loan_because: We, the lovers of cats, loan  because it makes us sad to see how tragic are some lives simply because they are poor.  That can, and must change, and it will change.  The world can never be purrfect, but it can be happier!
teams.description: How can we cat lovers help you?  We don't have much, but we're willing to share, IF you are willing to help yourselves.  We only want for this world to be a better place, for everyone, even cats.

teams.name: KivaFriends - Single Parent Loans
teams.loan_because: we support and want to help single parents throughout the world.   It is very difficult to raise successful men and women and it becomes even more difficult when we live in poverty.
teams.description: We are a group of lenders throughout the world that want to help men and women be successful in raising their own families.

teams.name: KivaFriends - Agriculture Loans
teams.loan_because: we want to reduce world hunger.  This includes loans for farming, livestock, poultry, and the like.
teams.description: Our group makes loans to people that create more food for those in the world.  Many of these entrepreneurs are farmers that often request loans to help them with their crops.  Many times these loans are for a longer repayment period.

teams.name: The Mi-Fi Network
teams.loan_because: We want to make a difference.
teams.description: The Mi-Fi Network is an organization whose purpose is to connect high schoolers interested in microfinance - particularly microcredit- across the country. Through the creation of microfinance clubs, each participating chapter raises a fund to invest in a particular community via Kiva.org. Because microcredit deals with loans, the money raised by each chapter will be able to be used again and again by subsequent classes, creating an investment fund, so to speak, for each school. The Mi-Fi Network aims to connect those students involved through the process of educating their respective communities about microfinance, as well as to provide a venue to discuss global issues, financial and social, with equally interested students from across the country.

teams.name: Central Valley Liberty
teams.loan_because: We would like to help people around the world make a better life for themselves and their families.
teams.description: We are a group of girls (soon young women) who have been playing soccer together for many years.  Our Kiva team includes our parents, other family members, coaches, and friends.

teams.loan_because: why not?

teams.name: Kiva U Colleges
teams.description:
Kiva U-College is an international network of microfinance clubs that gives university students an easy way to play a direct role in changing lives. Kiva U's mission is to educate students about the potential impact of microfinance, and to encourage microlending through Kiva's lending teams. 

Kiva U is world-wide and it continues to grow. In the coming school year, Kiva U will provide its chapters with the infrastructure and resources they need to establish a permanent presence on campus. The program will offer its chapters a variety of opportunities to participate in competitions and conferences, and will strongly encourage intra-university collaboration.

teams.name: Calgary, Canada
teams.loan_because: Living in such a great city as Calgary with all the opportunities that entails, surely we can make an effort to help others less fortunate. We all can make a big difference with just a small loan.
teams.description:
This team is for residents of Calgary, former residents, people wtih friends and family here or for anyone who really loves the city!

To those who do not wish to receive an email when messages are posted to the board, there is a simple fix: Go to your portfolio, then your account, then email preferences and you can disable/enable from there. I myself have turned it off as I am a member of several groups and do not want to receive masses of emails.

teams.loan_because: we feel that we can help the world, one person at a time.
teams.description:
There are many Kiva lenders who live in Japan, and we hope to be able to make a difference, not only as individuals, but now as a team. Please feel free to join us....not only from anywhere in Japan, but anywhere in the world. All you need is an interest in Japan. 

一緒に貧困をなくしましょう．．．お待ちしています！

teams.loan_because: We want to support Kiva entrepreneurs in every way we can.
teams.description: We are Kiva volunteer translators and friends who are inspired to support Kiva entrepreneurs with our translation skills and with loans.

teams.description: The Seattle Kiva Lending Team is for people who love Kiva as much as they do Seattle.

teams.name: Women and Associations for Gain both Economic and Social (WAGES)
teams.loan_because: We support gender equity and poverty alleviation through the power of microfinance.
teams.description: We support WAGES urban entrepreneurs throughout  Togo's capital city.

teams.name: In Memory of Paul Lambert
teams.loan_because: We all want to remember Paul.
teams.description: Paul was a Volunteer Coordinator at Kiva.  He spoke four languages (English, French, Spanish and Russian).  He touched the lives of many through his work and the hearts of countless through his friendship.  We all miss him.

teams.name: Team USA

teams.description: We are animal lovers who want to help those less fortunate in the poor areas of the world.

teams.name: hi5 Community on Kiva!
teams.loan_because: “Kiva’s principles of entrepreneurship, serving a global community, and leveraging the power of crowds are very complementary to hi5’s mission, so it seems only natural that we join them in the fight to help eradicate poverty in many parts of the developing world,” said Ramu Yalamanchi, CEO of hi5. “By linking our user base with the profiles of Kiva entrepreneurs, we are connecting a diverse group of people who want to change our world for the better and ensure the right resources exist to do it.”
teams.description: Headquartered in San Francisco, hi5 is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing social networks and mobile web networks. Our focus is to empower our users to build and maintain connections between friends and family online. With over 56 million unique visitors every month, hi5 is a top 20 website globally and the number one social network in 31 countries across Latin America, Europe, Asia and Africa. The service is available in 37 languages, delivering localized content and applications to users worldwide.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Kiva Detroit
teams.loan_because: We want to champion small businesses in Detroit!
teams.description:
Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. 

The goal of the Kiva Detroit team is to empower Detroiters to champion local small businesses through Kiva. 

To double your impact, your loan to a Kiva Detroit borrower will be matched 1-to-1 by the Knight Foundation

teams.name: Kiva City
teams.loan_because: We support small business owners in the United States.
teams.description:
We support small businesses and want to do more to bring Kiva to cities in the U.S.

If you are interested in loaning to small business owners in the U.S. or if you want to help bring Kiva to your city, this team is a community to expand the reach of Kiva in America.

teams.name: Teachers for Change
teams.loan_because: "A hundred years from now, it will not matter what kind of car I drove, what kind of house I lived in, how much money I had in the bank...but the world may be a better place because I made a difference in the life of a child."
teams.description: "We all teach citizenship and caring with everything we do. This group is going to allow us to show it in force. No Child Left Behind taken to the higher level, out of politics and into concern for all the families of our global neighborhood."  -A Team member

teams.name: InSite Yoga
teams.loan_because:
Our mission is to help individuals and communities progress toward the fullest expression of their potential.

Lending through Kiva is one way in which we can fulfil our purpose and extend our support to entrepreneurs and organizations around the world. 

It is also one of the ways we take our yoga practice 'off the mat and into the world'. 

So, in the spirit of generosity, compassion, and freedom we invite you to join our lending team and give loans that change lives.
teams.description: InSite Yoga develops educational programs and services which help individuals and communities access the well-documented benefits of yoga and progress toward the fullest expression of their potential.

teams.name: Kiva Jews
teams.loan_because: Tikkun Olam - making the world a better place.
teams.description: One of Judaism's most famous scholars, Maimonides, said that the highest form of charity is to help someone no longer need charity - and lending to Kiva does that.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Synergy
teams.loan_because: Entrepreneurial spirits are amazing and Karma makes this world a better place.

teams.loan_because: Living in such a great city as Calgary with all the opportunities that entails, surely we can make an effort to help others less fortunate. We all can make a big difference with just a small loan.
teams.description:
This team is for residents of Calgary, former residents, people wtih friends and family here or for anyone who really loves the city!

To those who do not wish to receive an email when messages are posted to the board, there is a simple fix: Go to your portfolio, then your account, then email preferences and you can disable/enable from there. I myself have turned it off as I am a member of several groups and do not want to receive masses of emails.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.loan_because: We believe in the generosity of the human spirit that is still alive within Americans of all backgrounds.

teams.loan_because: The K State family is always willing to lend a hand at home or abroad.
teams.description: Go State!

teams.name: Kiva Team Captains
teams.loan_because: We want to bring people together to raise awareness about Kiva in our communities.
teams.description: This group is about empowering Team Captains to become Community Marketers.  It is our goal to provide Kiva's biggest advocates with more tools to spread the word about Kiva.

teams.name: Stuff You Should Know from HowStuffWorks.com
teams.loan_because: We care.
teams.description: Arguably the finest assemblage of people who have never met dedicated to the common purpose of hastening global peace in $25 increments.

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.name: Finland
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Finland

teams.name: none of the above
teams.loan_because: why not?

teams.name: India
teams.loan_because: "What we should aim at is the creation of people power, which is opposed to the power of violence and is different from the coercive power of state." - Vinoba Bhave
teams.description:
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty.

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva/2012/08/15/kiva-launches-in-india.html

teams.name: Singapore
teams.loan_because: every effort matters, every offered hand deserves another, and any contribution counts.
teams.description: Our efforts might be small but they're a big difference to someone else, and ever so worth it.

teams.name: Unitarian Universalists
teams.loan_because:
We believe in:
**The inherent worth and dignity of every person
**Justice, equity and compassion in human relations
**Acceptance of one another and encouragement to spiritual growth in our congregations
**A free and responsible search for truth and meaning
**The right of conscience and the use of the democratic process within our congregations and in society at large
**The goal of world community with peace, liberty, and justice for all
**Respect for the interdependent web of all existence of which we are a part.
teams.description:
We are UU congregations and individuals (including those who describe themselves as "active" or "backslid" or "interested friends" or "just looking") throughout the world. 
For more information on us, or to find a congregation near you, check out the main website for the Unitarian Universalist Association

teams.name: Iceland
teams.loan_because: We believe in entrepreneurial spirit and want to make our contribution to make the world a better place.
teams.description:
Iceland is a European island country in the North Atlantic Ocean. Our country is volcanically and geologically active, our most famous volcano being Eyjafjallajökull, which erupted in 2010 and made the headlines worldwide. 

Iceland has a total population of only about 320,000 but even though we are few we are proud of being independent and we are always willing to help those that are in need.

teams.name: KivaFriends - Agriculture Loans
teams.loan_because: we want to reduce world hunger.  This includes loans for farming, livestock, poultry, and the like.
teams.description: Our group makes loans to people that create more food for those in the world.  Many of these entrepreneurs are farmers that often request loans to help them with their crops.  Many times these loans are for a longer repayment period.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: George Mason University
teams.loan_because: When individuals invest in the efforts of promising entrepreneurs everyone involved benefits.
teams.description:
George Mason University (often referred to as Mason) is a large public university with a main campus in the City of Fairfax, Virginia, United States. Additional campuses are located in Arlington, Prince William, and Loudoun.

Named after American revolutionary, patriot, and founding father George Mason, the University was founded as a branch of the University of Virginia in 1957 and became an independent institution in 1972. Recognized for its strong law, economics, nursing and public policy programs the university is growing.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:

teams.name: South Pacific Business Development (SPBD)
teams.loan_because: SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. It is these qualities which make people credit worthy, not the collateral which traditional banks demand.
teams.description: A group of passionate individuals that recognize the importance of SPBD's work in Samoa. We believe SPBD allows women and their families to pursue their dreams and achieve their full potential.

teams.name: Kiva Muslims
teams.loan_because:
002.271 Yusuf Ali Translation:
If ye disclose (acts of) charity, even so it is well, but if ye conceal them, and make them reach those (really) in need, that is best for you: It will remove from you some of your (stains of) evil. And Allah is well acquainted with what ye do.
teams.description: Insha'Allah our team will be a collaboration of people from all walks of life united by one goal: to help those less fortunate and displaying great appreciation to our creator for blessing us to help make a differerence in the world.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Gadget Lovers
teams.loan_because: Microcredit opens doors to entrepreneurs no matter what circumstances they live in.
teams.description: We love our gadgets.  This unites us and inspires us to make a difference together.

teams.name: Entrepreneurs & Business Owners
teams.loan_because: We have a passion for seeing other people succeed and helping them to achieve total freedom and success in business.
teams.description: We are a group of entrepreneurs, business owners, and leaders who take action to change our life and the life of others.

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

https://crimestoppers-uk.org/get-involved/our-campaigns/national-campaigns/human-trafficking

Courses our team members might be interested in joining for free: 

Coursera:     
                                              
https://www.coursera.org/course/water 26th May, 2014

Edx:

Resilience https://www.edx.org/course/uwashingtonx/uwashingtonx-ecfs311x-becoming-resilient-1652#.UznR_Gco-M9  6th May,2014


We have been informed that “It is against Kiva’s terms of use http://www.kiva.org/legal/terms to use team message boards or personal lender pages for self-promotion or to solicit funding for things not related to Kiva.”

For anyone needing further information about Kiva's policy on people requesting money for themselves, other individuals or organisations on Kiva web pages please contact Kiva.

Safe Girls Team Captains.

teams.name: Dartmouth College
teams.loan_because: We're smartie pants people... and we'd like to give other folks opportunities to succeed too!
teams.description: Dartmouth College Students, Faculty, Staff, Friends, Parents, and Alumni

teams.name: Grameen-Jameel
teams.loan_because:
we believe lending to Entrepreneurs is a powerful catalyst for positive change.

The power to start making a change is in our hands . . . one loan at a time.
teams.description:
Grameen Jameel was established as a company in 2003 and incorporated in 2007 as a joint venture between Grameen Foundation and Abdul Latif Jameel Community Initiatives.

The company’s mission is to help alleviate poverty by providing financial and technical assistance to microfinance institutions in the Middle East, North Africa and Turkey Region (MENA&T).

teams.name: Denmark
teams.loan_because:
All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights. They are endowed with reason and conscience and should act towards one another in a spirit of brotherhood. 
(Article 1  of United Nations Declaration of Human Rights)
teams.description:
Team for everyone in Denmark, who are taking part of this great opportunity to improve the world one step at a time.

Use this to recruite friends. http://www.kiva.org/invitedto/denmark/by/freetrial

Location: HeartMath Denmark
Street: Gammel Strand 34 . 4 floor , 1202 Copenhagen K

More Info:: Facebook-group: Kiva Denmark  link: http://www.facebook.com/groups/55972417726/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Gruppen her er for alle i Danmark, der støtter denne fantastiske ide om at hjælpe verden ét skridt af gangen.

Vil du hjælpe: Inviter venner - fortæl om Kiva 
http://www.kiva.org/invitedto/denmark/by/freetrial

Kiva Denmark holder møder om hvad vi kan gøre for at udbrede kendskabet til denne unikke måde at hjælpe på. Kontakt: Kristine.flagstad@uni-c.dk hvis du har nogen ideer eller skriv en meddelelse her til gruppen.

Næste møde holdes hos: HeartMath Danmark
Adresse: Gammel Strand 34 . 4 sal, 1202 Copenhagen K
Dato: Ikke fastlagt pt. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Se evt. mere på facebook gruppen : http://www.facebook.com/groups/55972417726/

teams.name: Tranceaddict
teams.loan_because: we can.
teams.description: TranceAddict is a 105,000+ strong community of electronic dance music lovers (Trance, Techno, House, etc) from all over the world.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Florida State University
teams.loan_because: The team members want to give back to the world through Kiva loans.

teams.name: Global Living
teams.loan_because: We loan because we believe as  international families we can give many lives across the globe a chance for success by providing opportunities for those willing to act on their dreams.
teams.description: We are international families who work, live, and raise our families in a multitude of host countries across the globe.

teams.name: P2P-Banking.com
teams.loan_because: Common interest in peer to peer lending, microfinance and using the internet as a tool for change
teams.description: Readers of P2P-Banking.com blog

teams.name: salesforce.com
teams.loan_because: We want to contribute to a sustainable future and make loans to those who are growing food and agriculture businesses.
teams.description: Our team is a group of employees from salesforce.com that volunteer and donate to organizations supporting a sustainable future.

teams.name: DoSomething
teams.loan_because: DoSomething.org is the country’s largest not-for-profit for young people and social change. We have 1,666,208 members (and counting) who kick ass on causes they care about. Bullying. Animal cruelty. Homelessness. Cancer. The list goes on. DoSomething.org spearheads national campaigns so 13- to 25-year-olds can make an impact - without ever needing money, an adult, or a car. Over 2.4 million people took action through DoSomething.org in 2012. Why? Because apathy sucks.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Building Learning Communities
teams.loan_because: We can make a difference and bring "meaning" to the classroom.
teams.description:
In 2008, Alan invited Jessica Flannery, the co-founder of Kiva, to present at BLC. Jessica told a very touching story of why she wanted to help the working poor. Since that time, the Building Learning Communities’ team has loaned $10.385.00 to struggling entrepreneurs around the world. We would like to invite you to help grow our team and have even more impact.

Kiva is a non-profit website that allows you to lend as little as $25 to a specific low-income entrepreneurs around the world. You choose who to lend to - whether a baker in Afghanistan, a goat herder in Uganda, a farmer in Peru, a restaurateur in Cambodia or a tailor in Iraq - and as they repay the loan, you get your money back. 

By joining our lending team, we can work together to alleviate poverty.

teams.name: Kiva City
teams.loan_because: We support small business owners in the United States.
teams.description:
We support small businesses and want to do more to bring Kiva to cities in the U.S.

If you are interested in loaning to small business owners in the U.S. or if you want to help bring Kiva to your city, this team is a community to expand the reach of Kiva in America.

teams.name: Kiva Detroit
teams.loan_because: We want to champion small businesses in Detroit!
teams.description:
Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. 

The goal of the Kiva Detroit team is to empower Detroiters to champion local small businesses through Kiva. 

To double your impact, your loan to a Kiva Detroit borrower will be matched 1-to-1 by the Knight Foundation

teams.name: 101 Cookbooks
teams.loan_because: There were nearly a million visits to 101 Cookbooks last month - a statistic that continues to amaze me. As the site has grown over the years, I kept thinking to myself that it would be great to figure out a way for us to affect change as a group - Kiva (with its team lending) is a great way for us to do that.
teams.description: Readers of Heidi Swanson's online recipe journal (blog) 101cookbooks.com
